I skipped 11 out of the given 12 days we could miss in his class, and still passed with an 88. If you practice his "study exams" religiously, and at least try the bonus homework, you'll pass. It's not easy material though, so study up!

I appreciated that there were many opportunities to earn bonus points and improve your grade. The MyMathLab was not required but was very helpful in grasping and practicing the concepts taught and bonus points were given for completion. The professors inclulsion of practice exams were very helpful and lets you know what is expected on the exams.

Overall, this was a good class. I attended every lecture, did most of the homework, & managed a B. I would of had an A, however I did not prepare well enough for the 2nd exam. Noring clearly knows what he's talking about, however in order to understand his lecture, it helps to do the homework while he's lecturing in order to understand the concepts

If you don't want to work hard, don't even bother to take it! You HAVE TO do your MyMathLab! Simply because to study math one must practice it. Yes, it is close to 300 practicing exercises, but those who really work on them have greater grades on tests and final grade. Do your MML and you won't regret! He is ready to help if you are ready to work!

This guy is cool, he's pretty awkward and cracks jokes that sort of goofy funny. But you can tell he only means good and you can tell he's a sweetheart. Gives abunch of extra credit you just gotta stay persistent and do it and it'll be rewarding in the end. I got an A and opted out of taking the final. He's a nice guy and relatively easy. Take him

Dr Noring Is an amazing professor. He works so hard and try so hard to get his students to get an A in class. And he make the class so convenient even when you are not able to make to the test he can work around your schedule. I will take him again for other math classes.

Noring is awesome! He gave study guides for each test, made MML optional for bonus points, told cool stories in class of how math relates to the real world. He goes slow through the material to make sure everyone know it. Definitely willing to help students that come to him. Highly recommend, I got an A in his class if it helps at all.
Professor Noring wants all his students to give it their all and succeed. I recommend for students who are willing to work for it.

Dr. Noring is awesome! He really cares about his students and wants everyone to do well. Calc 2 is a hard class but I went into every test knowing what to expect because he lays out his expectations. Wish he were teaching calc 3!

He teaches his trig class from a calc mindset not a trigalgebra one so it is VERY confusing. He will always make calc references that you won't get unless you know calc. I had to self teach in order to pass with a B. No mandatory homework, but it counts as extra credit, and you have to work very hard for it. Would not reccommend for trig.
Do your homework!  His quizzes are based on them and so are his tests.  Attend the SI sessions.  Every little bit helps.

Dr. Noring was a wonderful professor!  He provided extra help outside of his office hours every Friday for over an hour ( something most professors do not do). He was always willing to answer questions and made sure that every student was on the same page with the material presented. He likes to get to know his students, which is great!

Dr. Noring is a fantastic teacher and a great guy. I am really impressed by how much he cares about his students and how much effort he puts into his class. He knows his material very well, and gives students every opportunity imaginable for extra help. I don't particularly enjoy integrals, but I couldn't be mad because I had such a great teacher!

Dr. Noring is one of the most sincerely good people you will ever meet. If you introduce yourself, he will remember you long after you leave his class. He gives ample opportunity to get extra points by going to tutoring and doing optional homework. It is an extremely hard subject, but he is the one you want to take to get a high grade. 1010

He gives you extra credit that you can EARN.  HE cares deeply for his students and is very intelligent. I took calc-1 years ago and still pulled off an A in his class.  His lectures are from the book, so if you don't understand just refer back to the book.  I CANNOT SEE WHY WOULD ANY STUDENT SEE HIS CLASS AS CONFUSING. HE IS PURE AWESOMENESS!!!

Very, very confusing in lecture. Does not describe things different ways and when you ask for help he just repeats himself.  When trying to get help or even in lecture when working problems he will get the wrong answer and just say oh well, or he won't know what he did wrong.  Generous with bonus points, but have to work crazy hard for them.

This class is a lot of work, but if you are a good student then you will do well. Go to every class, do MyMathLab, and study for the tests. I don't think he is the best at lecturing because he lacks organization. This is a do it yourself class and he frequently says that, but he sets you up for success if you are a good student.

I worked 70+ hours of MyMathLab, missed 3 classes, went to SI religiously, went to office hours 3 times, & managed an 86 B. I taught myself through MyMathLab & asked him questions in lecture. I still took notes, but they are very theory-based & not many problems worked. He goes off on tangents at times but still a very good professor! I RECOMMEND.

Dr Noring is a good teacher. His lectures can get somewhat monotonous but you can tell he really knows what he is doing. At the beginning of each class he worked My Math Lab problems but when one has already done those problems this activity can become somewhat disageeable.
Do mymathlab, show up to class, do mymathlab, get an A or B depending on how good you are at calc.

Professor Noring is one of the most helpful professors there is. Any questions you have he is more than happy to help you. Sometimes in his explanations he gets a little carried away and goes to in-depth. You use a lot of the text book, and you have to do your homework in the class. The lectures are long and boring, but its a math class.

Dr. Noring is a good teacher, and makes Calculus easy. He is an engineer, so he constantly explains how the stuff you are learning is applied to the real world. I find that extremely helpful. I hate math classes that concentrate on pure theory without any practice. However, I believe the class was not as rigorous as it should have been.

Calculus II is a tough class however Dr. Noring provides study guides for each exams that are extremely helpful.  Don't skip class and do the Math Lab it will help in the end for your final grade.  The final is long and barley had time to finish so you need to know your stuff.  I made a C, but I'm not that good in math so if your like me, take him

This guy LOVES math! But that's a good thing! You have to put in the effort to get the grade you want. Gives plenty of opportunity for extra credit. 0 complaints but the only thing I would have liked would have been an overview of the entire course on the first day of class. Definitely take his class.
His tests start easy, but by the final he ramps up the difficulty a lot. Don't be fooled in the early days. Go to SI sessions if they're offered.

He's so wonderful! He's willing to help you if you just do the work!! Do the mymathlab and you will surely get an A. He gives study guides before tests and the tests just have different numbers. He knows his subject well- he's the type to make up questions off the top of his head. ASK QUESTIONS!!!!

Professor Noring was easily one of the best math teachers i have ever had. You have to work for your grade in this class. He allows you to exempt your final if you go to class a certain amount of times and get a 90 or above on the 4 tests. Math lab is crucial to get a A. He gives a study guide for every exam which is the test just different numbers

Professor Noring loves to teach and understands his students. You can’t take his class and just do enough to get a good grade, you will learn the course content and some important life lessons(if you dare to listen- he’ll turn out to be one of the five most impressionable people every person meets in life). I wish more teachers were like him!!

Professor Noring is the best math professor at KSU. I highly recommend you taking his. If you are a  nontraditional student and don't understand math, I recommend you taking him. There need to be more professor like him. He is a "A" in my book.

Professor Noring is the BEST math professor at KSU. I will recommend if you are a nontraditional student and need to understand Calculus, I recommend you taking his class. He is the BEST. take my word.

Wonderful teacher. Very energetic about math. Book is not needed. Bonus points are awarded. Challenging class made much easier by Norings positivity, approachability, and enthusiasm. Practice tests are given before each exam which helps a great deal. I definitely recommend.
Fantastic teacher. Is very clear about the requirements of the course. Gives practice tests and tons of extra credit. You'd be an idiot to take calc 2 from anyone else.

He goes on tangents that makes what he's trying to explain really confusing but he makes it so that you can get an A in his class. Attendance isn't mandatory but he gives EC for showing up, & PLENTY other chances for EC. (Do every EC he offers & you'll get an A) Study guides are test w/ diff #s. Take him for calc 1 & 2. He's always available 4 help

Professor Noring gives you a lot of opportunity to make bonus and extra credit.  If you can't pass his class it is because you did not try.  He loves math to the point of being nerdy beyond comprehension.  Take his class, show up for class, do the assignments and best part is, he gives you practice tests that almost replicate the test. Nice guy too

Absolutely wonderful teacher. It was because of Mr. Noring's helpfulness and passion that I thought I had a chance at math and now I am going on to pursue a math based degree which I never thought would happen. He gives you plenty of opportunities for extra credit and takes notice and rewards you if you improve. Work hard and you will do well.

Dr. Noring is a great calculus professor. He has an incredible passion for math, and it shows. In addition, he offers plenty of extra credit opportunities for his students. As long as you show up to his class, complete the online homework, and study for the tests, an A is completely plausible.
Really good professor , willing to help you out whenever you ask. Lecture were quite boring but i enjoyed the class. If you do your work it is an easy A
He was a great teacher! Very helpful and clear when explaining things. Gave many opportunities for extra credit and opportunities to opt out of the final. He was awesome, definitely take him!

Very good.  He was always willing to help. Do the homework and attend class.  There is no reason that you can't get at least a B.  The practice test are basically the same as the actual test, but slightly different questions.

Go to class, do the homework (all of it, every time) and the extra credit. If you do you'll easily pass. If you don't get at least a B in his class you shouldn't be in college. Best math teacher I've ever had. Do whatever it takes to get into his section.

His a great teacher, and cares for his students. Offers extra credit. (Do IT). He is hard to understand most of the time. He likes solving problems longest way possible. So just find shortcuts, and you'll be good. HE REALLY CARES FOR HIS STUDENTS. Attendance is kinda important, you'll see in first day in class. He's complex teacher to understand.

He is a great teacher, he doesn't explain everything well. All I do in class is my MyMathLabs and ignored his lectures unless its something super complex and I really can't understand. He offers a lot of extra credit(JUST DO IT), He's grading system is easy. HE CARES for his students. The class might get boring sometimes sitting there for 3 hours.
Wonderful Professor! He explains the material very well and is one of the few professors who care if their students pass or fail. Strongly suggest!!!!
Very good professor. He understands that not every student he has has had a strong prior education in math. He works with you to make sure you understand concepts.

Attendance isn't 100% mandatory but you'll either have points awarded or taken away based on the number of lectures attended. All of the material and homework comes from the online mathlab. Personally, I spent every class doing homework instead of listening to leactures. He's very friendly, helpful, and definitely knows the material he teaches.

Very nice teacher. Always had a positive attitude. The class was not long enough and I was not good at math. He reviews the work but went through it very fast which did not help me. A lot of homework so do NOT leave it for last minute bc you will not finish.

Great Teacher.He is very helpful,i was failing the class but he took time during his office hours to help me out,i was able to make a great come back to pass the Class. Practice test were very helpful. All you have to do is ask for help if you need it and he will take time to explain .

The Class has ALOT of homework, but if you do it all you'll understand the material. Teacher offered AMPLE extra-credit, and formulaically offers a several ways to exempt from the final. Attendance wasn't mandatory, except for on test days, but definitely show up to atleast 12 classes. Lastly BUY ACCESS CODE, comes with etext. no text needed.
Great teacher, when he offers help take advantage. Attendance is bonus points so I would suggest showing up
Amazing professor! He really does want all his students to succeed. Show up to class and do your mymathlab on time and you should easily get an A! I would highly recommend him!
Very good teacher. He wants all students to do good. Your grades reflect on how much work you put in. If I would have put more effort into mymathlab I'm sure I would have gotten an A.
Best math professor I ever had

Very helpful. Gives you many opportunities for extra credit. If you don't get an A or B in thus class, it's because you did not listen to him and/or you did absolutely nothing in his class. Highly recommended!

Such a sweet humble professor!!! He really knows what he's talking about! I honestly don't like math, but his class is awesome. He brings in tidbits from life outside of math and some things are interesting! DO THE MML homework and come to class! He gives extra credit and he's just really helpful!!! I got an A!! Take him!!! (:
Not interesting to listen to at all, but a nice enough guy. He's a very lenient grader. If you study on your own, you should have no problem getting an A in this class.

Mr. Noring is not the most interesting professor to listen to, but if you can teach yourself, you will get an A. He is a very lenient grader. SHOW YOUR WORK ON TESTS. He will give you some points for trying even if you get the problem wrong. I would take a class with him again!

Great Teacher! Gives plenty of oppurtunites for you to get an A in the class. Do all of MyMathLab, he only ask for 75% completion but i did everything 90% and above and went to all of the class sessions for an extra 30 pts and received a 95 in the class. go over lesson before you go to class, makes it 10 times easier. Do MyMathLab ahead of time

By far the nicest, most helpful professor I've encountered thus far. As long as you complete the MyMathLabs consistently you'll make at least a B; there is a direct link between doing hw and having high grades. If he is available when you register for his class don't hesitate to choose Dr. Noring!

I found Dr. Noring very helpful in his coaching. His approach is  practically knowledge transfer rather than just cramming formulas. He is over-friendly and goes out of his way to make you gain the concepts. On our finals, he devoted 5hrs out of the normal class to help us get "A" s.

Professor Noring is a great man! He is not the best teacher, and this class is mostly self-taught. But if you know how to teach yourself, take him!! He is very favorable with grading, and he is always there to help his students. Take him!

Overall an easy class if you are able to learn on your own. Attendance is required. His grading is VERY favorable and truly has a desire for his students to do well. His teaching style is a little different than most. I received an A in his class without having to take his final. Lots of extra credit points thaat are easy to attain.

Mr. Noring is an EXCELLENT teacher that tries really hard and is very motivated to teach his students. I  learned A LOT in his class and if you put effort I have noticed he will help you. He comes highly recommended by me. I am a 3rd year college student which first went to GPC and now at KSU I am hopefully going to Law School in less than 2 years.

Professor Noring is one of the nicest teachers. I attended class at first, but I stopped after the first couple of weeks (not mandatory but get bonus points) MyMathLab is required, which I used to teach myself instead of attending class. Pretty easy class. He gives you a review before every test. Highly recommend Professor Noring!
I really appreciated this professors enthusiasm for the material.  Math is difficult for me and he made it almost easy to learn.  I finally understood things I should have mastered years ago.

Mr. Noring is wonderfully passionate about math and a lot of people don't care but I found it inspiring. I was able to bring my grade out of the gutter and he recognized my improvement with bonus points. Very kind and understanding. Definitely do the MyMathLab as you go and it'll be a piece of cake.
Professor Noring was a really great teacher. He gives several opportunities for students to succeed and you can tell he really loves his job. Do the homework and you will be fine in this class.

Prof. Noring runs a pretty fast paced class only because he knows his subject and is very passionate for it; however, he welcomes questions and keeps office hours for extra help.  DO THE HOMEWORK...ON TIME!!!  If you need a good grade in Math 1111, take Noring!
Great teacher, always willing to help. You def have to study but he gives you a lot of chances to earn extra points. Highly recommend taking him for college algebra.

His enthusiasm for math shows and plays a big part in his teaching. He offers practice tests and TONS of extra points(attending class, MML, test improvement). While the class may seem boring, he extends help to anyone in case you don't retain the topic.

Great class! Professor Noring is very passionate about what he does. The subject can be a bit dry but that's math. The great thing about this class is that he offers his help as much as possible and provides practice tests for every section. The practice tests are extremely helpful. If you can do the practice test you can do the actual test.

Dr. Noring is very friendly and keeps class fairly interesting.  I did like math in highschool, so I didn't expect it to be hard, but it was extra easy.  Unlimited tries on homework.  If you can, take him!

Nice, mild-mannered guy and very helpful. Attendance is not mandatory but he does give out random quizzes which are about 10% of the grade. Easy class, I recommend taking him no matter what kind of student you are. All homework is done online.

If you have Prof Noring, you are truly blessed. Whether you are terrible with math or a math whiz, you need to go to class. He sneaks in a lot of pop quizzes to make sure you go!! Also, if you ever have a problem...EVER...talk to him. He is the most considerate and most helpful individual employed this college. I wish I could take him again!

You will not find another professor as interested in math as Dr. Noring. He genuinely loves his subject matter. This is the only mathematics teacher I have ever had who has taught comprehension and understanding of what you are learning. If you truly wish to understand mathematics, highly recommended professor.

Prof. Noring is so AWESOME. He's really funny and he makes a lot of nerdy jokes. You can tell he loves math and he honestly helps if you don't understand something. The material itself is challenging but with Prof. Noring you can do it. I wasn't the best in math in High School but in his class I feel like I am learning something. :D

I think that Mr.Noring is a great teacher! I am not good at math at all.He is willing to help you in any way he can. He has study sessions, and he gives study guides.The study guide is very similar to the Test itself! Although the HW is mandatory it can really help your grade.YOu are required to do 75% to 100%. One can easily tell that Dr. Noring is truly passionate about his subject matter. He seems like a really nice guy. However, I do not recommend taking him.
